intro: Phlomoides korovinii, commonly known as the Korovin's phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of Eurasia. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky and sandy soils, often in alpine or tundra environments. Its flowers are small, clustered in whorls, and usually have purple or violet hues. Phlomoides korovinii is adapted to cold climates and is often found in areas with limited soil nutrients.
